term_definitions.items: Дополнительная контекстная информация для хранения в Context_details
Для записи информации об одном или нескольких адресах.
*To record details of one or more personal addresses.!(en)
Почтовый адрес в неструктурированном формате. ENV 13606 - 4:2000 7.11.15.(en)
Период, в котором указанный адрес применим. ENV 13606 - 4:2000 7.11.11. This describes the actual period.(en)
Информация об имени физического лица, поставщика услуг или третьего лица
Лицо известное также под данным именем
Имя, используемое данным лицом до вступления в брак
Период времени, в течение которого действовало данное имя
Приставка или правовой титул, которые используется лицом
Имя, используемое лицом/объектом в сфере бизнеса или для профессиональных целей
Наименование, по которому объект является официально зарегистрированным
Имя объекта, как оно используется в отчетной документации в виде определенного идентификатора
Отметка, указывающая на то, что лицо желает быть идентифицированным по этому имени
Профессиональные демографические данные: имя (наименование), адрес(а), контактные данные
Профессиональные демографические данные: имя (наименование), адрес(а), контактные данные
Штатная должность, степень, ранг, звание субъекта.
Период участия специалиста в клиническом процессе, связанным с конкретным пациентом.
Сведения об организации, к которой относится субъект.
Для записи соответствующей информации при переносе в систему документов, которые были опубликованы ранее (на бумаге или в сторонней системе).
Универсальный архетип для подключения существующих CLUSTER-архетипов, которые необходимо отобразить как обособленную сущность.
Проблема, симптом или жалоба, сообщённая клиницисту, причина которой требуют разъяснений, понимания, исследования или лечения.
*The issue as presented by the person(en)
*Detailed information about the issue or health problem(en)
История болезни субъективного характера, записанная непосредственно Пациентом или которая была сообщена Врачу Пациентом или опекуном.
Дефолтный, неустановленный момент времени или интервал событий, который точно может быть определен на уровне template или во время выполнения.
*For example: a specific symptom such as nausea or pain; an event such as a fall off a bicycle; or an issue such as a desire to quit using tobacco.(en)
*For example: Local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
Дополнительная информация необходима для фиксирования локальных особенностей бизнес-процессов или для того, чтобы привести в соответсвие с другими референсными моделями/общепринятыми подходами.
Измерение температуры тела, которая является суррогатом температуры тела человека в целом.
*Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.(en)
Измеряется температура тела (как суррогат для всего тела).
Температура измеряется в наружном слуховом проходе.
Температура измеряется в кожной складке в подмышечной впадине, рука опущена вниз и прижата к туловищу.
На пациенте меньшее количество одежды / постельных принадлежностей, чем этого требуют условия внешней среды.
Одежда/постельные принадлежности пациента соответствуют условиям внешней среды.
На пациенте большее количество одежды / постельных принадлежностей, чем этого требуют условия внешней среды.
Описание особенностей, которые могут повлиять на результат измерения температуры тела.
Температура измеряется в паховой складке кожи между ногой и передней брюшной стенкой.
Подробная информация об условиях окружающей среды во время измерения температуры.
Подробная информация о нагрузках в момент измерения температуры.
Информация об устройстве, используемом для измерения температуры тела.
*e.g. Local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
Дополнительная информация, необходимая для захвата локального контента или согласования с другими ссылочными моделями / формализмами.
Дополнительный комментарий о измерении температуры тела, не записанный в других областях.
Структурированное анатомическое местоположение, в котором проводилось измерение.
Число дней с начала последнего нормального менструального цикла
*This is commonly carried as part of the medicine name and provided by the medicines terminology but in some cases must be specified separately.(en)
Подробная информация о компоненте лекарственного средства, включая сведения о каких-либо конкретных составляющих.
*This is commonly carried as part of the medicine name and provided by the medicines terminology but in some cases must be specified separately.!(en)
*Details of a medication component, including details of any specific constituents.!(en)
Компонент состоит из нескольких отдельных продуктов, которые предварительно упакованы изготовителем.

*For example: '2017-05-23'. This is intended for the date or time as given by the manufacturer or individual preparing the mixture. Any other form of expiry date, such as time from production or depending on storage environment, can be inserted using a specific CLUSTER archetype in the Substance Details slot or added as part of the Description. (en)
Дата истечения срока действия и/или время приема лекарственного средства, как правило указано изготовителем, но могут быть установлены отдельным человеком, готовящим специальную смесь.
*This is not normally required other than where an ad-hoc mixture of infusion is being described.(en)
Детали компонента, используемые для приготовления смешанного препарата или инфузии.
Химическое вещество имеет известный и желаемый эффект, который является положительным.
Это химическое вещество токсично и не имеет терапевтического эффекта.
Химическое вещество активно, но достичь терапевтического эффекта помогает другой компонент.
Присутствующий компонент продлевает срок действия вещества.
*For example: "10 mg/1", "5 %", "0.125 mg/ml", "100 ml/l", "10000 [arb'u]{SQ-U}/ml". The unit '1', for example in "mg/1" represents an administration unit such as tablet or puff.(en)
*This is not normally required other than where an ad-hoc mixture or infusion is being described.(en)
Детали компонента или продукта, используемые для приготовления смешанной упаковки, препарата или инфузии.
Роль компонента в смеси или инфузии
*For example: "Zinacef 750 mg powder" or "cefuroxim". This item should be coded if possible. Usage of component name will vary according to context of use.(en)
Подробности компонента, в котором описывается, то что невозможно полностью описать с использованием численных показателей.
*For example: Detailed information about the drug class or intended routes.(en)
*For example: Co-codamol is a Combination product, wile 50% white soft paraffin + 50% liquid paraffin is an Ad-hoc mixture, whose composition is fully specified within the order.(en)
Характер лекарственного компонента в отношении производства и количества ингредиентов.
Компонент состоит из смеси ингредиентов, указанных в заказе.
Компонент состоит из ряда ингредиентов, которые предварительно скомбинированы производителем.
Компонент состоит из одного действующего вещества.
Компонент представляет собой готовый продукт, в котором содержится один или несколько составных частей.
*For example: '5 mg' where the Constituent amount is '1 ml' as an alternate ingredient amount for a substance with strength '5mg/1ml'.(en)
Альтернативное, но эквивалентное представление о количестве компонента.
Идентификатор присваивается партии лекарственных средств производителем в процессе производства.
*For example: "2 mg/0.5 ml", "5 mg/10 g" or "10 ml/500 ml".(en)

*The substance amount is usually given using mass, volume or arbitrary units. However, there may be examples where other unit dimensions are used. For example: "5 mg", "100 ml", "20 IU" . Where a preparation strength is described as "5 mg/10 g", "5 mg" is the substance amount.(en)

*The diluent amount is usually given using mass or volume units. However, there may be examples where other unit dimensions are used. For example: "5 g", "100 ml". Where a preparation strength is described as "5 mg/10 g", "10 g" is the diluent amount.(en)

*Some vendors prefer giving strength for administration units such as tablets or puffs as a nominator quantity of mass, while leaving the denominator implied. The preferred way of recording strength is using the 'Strength as concentration' element.(en)
Масса активного вещества на массу компонента.

*For example: '2 tablets at 6pm' or '20mg three times per day'. Please note: this cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of a complete set of dose patterns for a single dose direction.(en)
Сочетание объема лекарственного средства и расписания его приема в контексте медицинского рецепта или управления приёма медикаментов.
Структурированные данные о схеме приёма в рамках одного дня.
Период времени, в течение которого следует вводить единичную дозу лекарства или вакцины.
*For example: '200 ml/h'. Use the text data type to record non- or semi-quantifiable instructions.(en)
Скорость, с которой нужно вводить лекарство, при инфузии.

*For example: '10mg/kg/day'. The result of this formula would normally be held in Dose amount/unit or Administration rate/duration. Where clinical measurements such as body weight is used in the dose calculation, a LINK attribute should used to specify which particular measurement has been used.(en)
Формула, используемая для расчета количества дозы или скорости введения, которая зависит от такого фактора, как масса тела или площадь поверхности тела.
Значение количества лекарств, вводимых единовременно, как действительное число или диапазон действительных чисел, и связанных с дозой.
*For example: 'tablet','mg'. Coding of the dose unit with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

*For example: '1', '2', '3'. Where multiple dosages are expressed, the 'Pattern sequence' makes the order in which they should be executed explicit. For example: (1) 1 tab in the morning, (2) 2 tab at 2pm, (3) 1 tab at night.(en)
Предполагаемое порядковое расположение дозы в составе последовательности доз.

*For example, can be used to represent a unit-dose based value such as 'tabs', when the Dose amount is expressed as an SI unit such as 'mg', or where it is required to express the total amount of an infusion as well as the dose amount of the active ingredient.(en)
Дополнительное представление количественного параметра единовременной дозы в виде действительного числа или диапазона чисел, свзяанное с единицой измерения.
Единица, связанная с альтернативным вариантом дозы.

*For example: "Apply ointment to affected area until it glistens". This element is intended to allow implementers to use the structures for increasing/tapering dosages without necessarily specifying the doses in a structured way.(en)
*Structured details of a single therapeutic direction for an ordered item, such as a medication or blood transfusion order.(en)

*For example: ''1' '2', '3'. Where multiple dosage directions are expressed, the 'Direction sequence' makes the order in which they should be executed explicit. For example: (1) 1 tab daily for 3 days, (2) 1 tab twice daily for 4 days, (3) 1 tablet for 7 days. (en)
*The intended position of this direction within the overall sequence of directions.(en)

*For example: 'for 7 days','Indefinite'. An example of a set of multiple directions, with varying durations might be ... '1 tablet daily for 3 days, 2 tablets daily for 4 days, then 3 tablets Indefinite'.(en)
*The length of time for which this direction should be applied.(en)
*The direction should be continued indefinitely with a strong recommendation that it never be discontinued.(en)
не определена, прием не подлежит прекращению
*For example: 'every 3 days', 'on Thursdays and Sundays', '3 days after onset of menstruation'.(en)
*Structured details about pattern of repetition for each set of daily directions.(en)
*For example, conditional instructions such as insulin /glucose infusion rates dependent on blood glucose, or detailed administration instructions for particular preparations.(en)
*Further details about an ordered item direction.(en)
*The maximum number of administrations to be given for this direction.(en)
*The combination of a medication dose and administration timing for a single day.(en)
Не вакцинировать, не проводить р. Манту
в период проведения АСИТ без согласования с аллергологом
Не вакцинировать вакцинами, в состав которых входят
вакцинация в условиях центра по иммунопрофилактики/ его филиала
вакцинировать при условии полного контроля симптомов аллергических болезней не менее 4 -6 недель на фоне их базисной терапии
при наличии эпид. показаний к вакцинации и нестабильном состоянии пациента внеплановая консультация аллерголога
не отменять и не изменять объём базисной терапии в период проведения вакцинации
дополнительная медикаментозная терапия в период вакцинации
*An order for a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item for an identified individual.(en)
*An order for a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item for an identified individual.!(en)
*An order for a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item for an identified individual.!!(en)
*This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.(en)
*The amount and units of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic good to be used or administered at one time.(en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)

*This narrative should normally subsume data captured in 'Dose amount', 'Dose timing' and any additional instructions for use. Where the medication dose directions are fully carried by the structured, computable dose directions, this element should carry the narrative equivalent, generally auto-generated. If it is not possible to represent the intended 'Dose direction' fully in computable form, partial representation is not recommended, and the directions should be only recorded in narrative form using this data element.(en)
*Complete narrative description about how the ordered item is to be used.(en)

*For example: 'Start if symptoms recur'. This is intended for a general pre-condition which should trigger the whole medication course to be started, and not for 'as required' administrations of an ongoing order.(en)
*A condition which, when met, requires the commencement of administration or use.(en)
*The date and optional time to commence use of the ordered item.(en)
*The date and optional time when it is planned to cease use of the ordered item.(en)
*A condition which, when met, requires the cessation of administration or use.(en)

*For example: 'Angina'. Coding of the clinical indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences. It is not intended to carry an indication for administrative authorisation purposes.(en)
*The clinical reason for use of the ordered item.(en)

*For example: precautions as 'take with food', 'Avoid grapefruit', 'Dissolve in water', 'store in a cool, dry place'. This data element allows multiple occurrences and should be coded with a reference terminology, where possible.(en)
*An additional instruction on how to use or store the ordered item.(en)
*Generally this is only used when passing information between legacy systems. For example: '10mg bd; 20mg n' as used by the NHS Dose syntax (in development).(en)
*A parsable, computable text representation of the directions.(en)
*For example: To record that the patient had been taking antibiotics 3 days prior to hospital admission, in the context of a 7 day course.(en)
*The time period during which the individual/patient has already been using the ordered item as a part of the intended whole order but prior to the issuance of this order.(en)

*For example: 'up to 1gram per day'. This cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of multiple maximum doses that apply to different time periods. Lifetime maximum dose should not be carried here as it refers to multiple orders over time.(en)
*Details about the maximum, cumulative dose allowed over a defined period for the ordered item.(en)
*The period of time during which the maximum dose is calculated.(en)
*For example: To record that the patient has taken the two first antibiotic tablets of a three day course, prior to discharge from the hospital to a nursing home.(en)
*The number of administrations of the ordered item that have been completed, as part of the intended whole order but prior to the issuance of this order.(en)
*Details about medication safety for the ordered item.(en)
*Confirmation by the prescriber that the normal dose or other safety limit has been overridden due to exceptional circumstances.(en)
*This SLOT allows for local variation in the different jurisdictions regarding medication dispensing amount to be managed.(en)
*Details about the amount of the ordered item to be dispensed.(en)
*For example: details of repeat/refill supply. This SLOT allows for local variation in the different jurisdictions regarding medication authorisation and re-authorisation to be managed.(en)
*Details of authorisation of the ordered item, including supporting local self-administration, issue and endorsement policies.(en)

*Depending on the prescribing context this field could be used for either generic- or product-based prescribing. This data field can be used to record tightly bound orders of different medications when they are prescribed as a single pack. It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' be coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack to be used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.(en)
*Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item being ordered.(en)
*For example: 'oral', 'intravenous', or 'topical'. Coding of the route with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Multiple potential routes may be specified.(en)
*The route by which the ordered item is to be administered into the subject's body.(en)
*For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'. Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Name of the site of administration of the ordered item.(en)
*Structured description of the site of administration of the ordered item.(en)
*For example: ' via Z-track injection'; 'via nebuliser'. Coding of the method with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*The technique or device by which the ordered item is to be administered.(en)
*Details of the medical device used to assist administration of the ordered item.(en)

*For example: 'To reduce your blood pressure', 'To thin your blood'. This data element allows multiple occurrences and should be coded with a reference terminology, where possible. If required it is possible to use a LINK attribute to associate this element with, for example, the 'original diagnosis' in a separate Problem list composition but the indication should be explicitly recorded here, as the link target may change over time.(en)
*An additional instruction directed primarily at the individual/patient or carers.(en)
*Example: Detailed instructions for phased dispensing of opiates.(en)
*An additional instruction directed primarily at the person dispensing the ordered item.(en)
*For example: 'Please check renal function in 2 weeks'. This data element allows multiple occurrences.(en)
*An additional instruction which gives advice on recommended or required monitoring of the ordered item.(en)

*Course summary may be required when transmitting medication information between systems or representing a FHIR Medication statement. For example: as part of a referral, emergency patient summary or discharge communication.(en)
*Summary information about use of the ordered item, such as current status or key dates, generally used in non-prescription contexts.(en)
*Directions about the dispensing of the ordered item.(en)
*The maximum, cumulative amount of medication which should be administered within the allowed period. The unit for this amount is carried in Maximum amount unit.(en)

*In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.(en)
*Permission for substitution with a bioequivalent item.(en)

*For example 'Urgent'. This is left to be templated or specialised according to local valuesets. Some jurisdictions allow instructions to dispense to be marked as 'urgent' so that the dispensary handles them quickly.(en)
*An indicator of the urgency with which the ordered item should be dispensed.(en)
*Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the ordered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.(en)
*Structured details about the overall preparation including strength, form and constituent substances.(en)
*For example: 'tablet','mg'. Coding of the dose unit with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*The unit for the maximum amount allowed.(en)
*The overall therapeutic intent of the ordered item.(en)

*The total daily dose records the expected effective dose, and thus support titration of an initial low dose towards the effective dose over a period of time. This is not itself the target dose or goal but the actual effective daily dose against that goal. In some circumstances the Total daily dose will be calcuable from computable directions, in others it may need to be manually entered.(en)
*Details about the total daily amount of the ordered item expected to be administered.(en)
*The amount of ordered item which will be taken each day if administered as intended.(en)
*The dose units are normally scientific units such as mg, ml rather than 'tablets'.(en)
*The dose unit associated with the total daily amount.(en)
*The reason why an ordered item should not be substituted at dispense.(en)
*May be used to control the time of dispensing of medications with potential for abuse. For example: benzodiazepines or analgesics.(en)
*The date from which the ordered item is permitted to be dispensed for the first time.(en)
*In some jurisdictions, orders to dispense may have an expiry date after which the prescription may not be dispensed.(en)
*The date after which the ordered item is no longer valid to be legally dispensed.(en)
*For example: 'Not responsive at maximum recommended dose. Critical situation.', 'Peniciilin is only valid treatment, likelihood of true penicillin allergy is low'.(en)
*The reason for a clinical safety or maximum dose override.(en)

*For example: 'Hypertension control', 'Target dose 20mg daily'. The description could be used to identify a name, phrase or paragraph about the purpose for recording total daily effective dose, commonly to allow to titration towards a specific target dose. The goal or target dose might be recorded here or more commonly as part of a linked EVALUATION 'Goal' archetype.(en)
*Description of the reason for recording a total daily effective dose.(en)
*Additional structured details about the ordered item not captured in other fields.(en)
*Additional narrative about the medication order not captured in other fields.(en)
*Substitution of the medication with a bioequivalent medication is allowed.(en)
*Substitution of the medication with a bioequivalent medication is not allowed.(en)
*This SLOT allows for local variation in the different jurisdictions regarding medication dispensing.(en)

*A known or recognised safety issue which applies to this subject and the ordered item, such as an allergy, drug duplication warning or contraindication. This element is normally only recorded when this safety advice is overridden.(en)

*In some settings, it is common to split overall narrative directions into more specific segments of narrative. For example in hospital settings, it can be common to split the overall directions into 'Dose amount' and 'Dose timing', both as narrative text. These terms can be applied at template or run-time.(en)
*A narrative description of a specific part of overall directions.(en)
*A description of the justification used to calculate a dose amount or administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor.(en)
*Details of structured dose and timing directions.(en)
*Overriding of a known or recognised safety issue which applies to this subject and the ordered item, such as an allergy, drug duplication warning or contraindication.(en)
Краткое изложение или обзор состояния здоровья пациента с клинической точки зрения, с или без соответствующих интерпретаций или выводов.
*The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.(en)

*A clinical intervention (including, but not limited to, use of a treatment or performance of a test or procedure) that should not be carried out due to the likelihood, or possibility, of harm being caused to an individual.(en)

*A clinical intervention (including, but not limited to, use of a treatment or performance of a test or procedure) that should not be carried out due to the likelihood, or possibility, of harm being caused to an individual.!(en)
*Coding of the identified 'Contraindicated intervention' with a terminology is desirable, where possible.(en)
*Identification, by name, of a clinical intervention or class of intervention including, but not limited to, a treatment, test or procedure that should not be performed.(en)
*Narrative description explaining the relationship between the 'Indication' and the 'Contraindicated intervention'.(en)
*Date when the contraindication information was last updated.(en)
*An indication of the potential for critical system organ damage or life threatening consequence.(en)
*Additional narrative about the contraindication, not captured in other fields.(en)

*In circumstances where contraindications are not indefinite or life-long, use this data element to record when this contraindication should be reassessed in the context of the clinical circumstances at the time. For example: schedule a review date that matches when it is expected that the family member will cease taking immunosuppressive therapy, such that live vaccines could safely be administered to the individual again and the contraindication is effectively resolved.(en)
*Date when next due for review by a clinician.(en)

*Carrying out of the 'Contraindicated intervention' is unlikely to result in critical system organ damage or life threatening consequences for the individual or family member. Future exposure to the identified intervention should be considered a relative contraindication in normal clinical circumstances.(en)

*Carrying out of the 'Contraindicated intervention' may result in critical organ system damage or life threatening consequences for the individual or family member. Future exposure to the identified intervention should be considered an absolute contraindication in normal clinical circumstances.(en)

*This data element has been included because it is currently being captured in some clinical systems. This information could be derived from the Intervention where coding systems are used, and is effectively redundant in that situation.(en)

*Decision support would typically raise alerts for 'Suspected', 'Likely', 'Confirmed', and ignore a 'Refuted' reaction. Clinical systems may choose not to display Contraindication entries with a 'Refuted' status in the Contraindication list. However, 'Refuted' may be useful for reconciliation of the Contraindication list or when communicating between systems . Some implementations may choose to make this field mandatory. 'Resolved' may be used variably across systems, depending on clinical use and context. The free text data type will allow for local variation by enabling other value sets to be applied to this data element in a template - in this situation it is recommended that values should be coded using a terminology.(en)
*Assertion about the certainty or potential future risk, of the identified 'Contraindicated intervention'.(en)
*A low level of clinical certainty that carrying out the 'Contraindicated intervention' will cause harm to the individual or family member.(en)
*A reasonable level of clinical certainty that carrying out the 'Contraindicated intervention' will cause harm to the individual or family member.(en)
*A high level of clinical certainty that carrying out the 'Contraindicated intervention' will cause harm to the individual or family member.(en)
*The previous assertion that the subject should not be exposed to the 'Contraindicated intervention' has been clinically reassessed and considered no longer to be an active risk.(en)

*The previous assertion that the subject should not be exposed to the 'Contraindicated intervention' has been clinically reassessed or has been disproved with a high level of clinical certainty by testing.(en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)

*In the context of this contraindication archetype, this 'Indication' data element represents the clinical reason why the identified Intervention should not be used or performed. Coding of the 'Indication' with a terminology is desirable, where possible. Please note: an optional URI link to evidence within the health record is also permitted using Reference Model attributes. Example: 'Pacemaker inserted' as indication to avoid performing an MRI Intervention.(en)
*Identification of the clinical reason why the identified 'Contraindicated intervention' should not be used or performed.(en)

*This data element is intended for use when a contraindication is identified to start at some time in the future. For example, the contraindication for MRI would only be relevant after the date of the procedure for insertion of the pacemaker.(en)

*Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)
*Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.(en)
*Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.(en)

*Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.(en)
*Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.(en)

*If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.(en)
*An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.
(en)
*Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth. (en)
*Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.(en)

*Use this SLOT to insert the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location archetypes if the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations.
If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant.
(en)
*A structured anatomical location for the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*May include structured detail about the grading or staging of the diagnosis; diagnostic criteria, classification criteria or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.(en)
*Details that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of this problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.(en)
*Structured details for location-, domain-, episode- or workflow-specific aspects of the diagnostic process.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis does not interfere with normal activity or may cause damage to health if left untreated.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis causes interference with normal activity or will damage health if left untreated.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis prevents normal activity or will seriously damage health if left untreated.(en)
*Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.(en)
*The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.(en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
*Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.(en)
*The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.(en)
*The diagnosis has been identified with a low level of certainty.(en)
*The diagnosis has been identified with a high level of certainty.(en)
*The diagnosis has been confirmed against recognised criteria.(en)
*Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.(en)
*Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.(en)
*This is commonly carried as part of the medicine name and provided by the medicines terminology but in some cases must be specified separately.(en)
Подробная информация о компоненте лекарственного средства, включая сведения о каких-либо конкретных составляющих.
*This is commonly carried as part of the medicine name and provided by the medicines terminology but in some cases must be specified separately.!(en)
*Details of a medication component, including details of any specific constituents.!(en)
Компонент состоит из нескольких отдельных продуктов, которые предварительно упакованы изготовителем.

*For example: '2017-05-23'. This is intended for the date or time as given by the manufacturer or individual preparing the mixture. Any other form of expiry date, such as time from production or depending on storage environment, can be inserted using a specific CLUSTER archetype in the Substance Details slot or added as part of the Description. (en)
Дата истечения срока действия и/или время приема лекарственного средства, как правило указано изготовителем, но могут быть установлены отдельным человеком, готовящим специальную смесь.
*This is not normally required other than where an ad-hoc mixture of infusion is being described.(en)
Детали компонента, используемые для приготовления смешанного препарата или инфузии.
Химическое вещество имеет известный и желаемый эффект, который является положительным.
Это химическое вещество токсично и не имеет терапевтического эффекта.
Химическое вещество активно, но достичь терапевтического эффекта помогает другой компонент.
Присутствующий компонент продлевает срок действия вещества.
*For example: "10 mg/1", "5 %", "0.125 mg/ml", "100 ml/l", "10000 [arb'u]{SQ-U}/ml". The unit '1', for example in "mg/1" represents an administration unit such as tablet or puff.(en)
*This is not normally required other than where an ad-hoc mixture or infusion is being described.(en)
Детали компонента или продукта, используемые для приготовления смешанной упаковки, препарата или инфузии.
Роль компонента в смеси или инфузии
*For example: "Zinacef 750 mg powder" or "cefuroxim". This item should be coded if possible. Usage of component name will vary according to context of use.(en)
Подробности компонента, в котором описывается, то что невозможно полностью описать с использованием численных показателей.
*For example: Detailed information about the drug class or intended routes.(en)
*For example: Co-codamol is a Combination product, wile 50% white soft paraffin + 50% liquid paraffin is an Ad-hoc mixture, whose composition is fully specified within the order.(en)
Характер лекарственного компонента в отношении производства и количества ингредиентов.
Компонент состоит из смеси ингредиентов, указанных в заказе.
Компонент состоит из ряда ингредиентов, которые предварительно скомбинированы производителем.
Компонент состоит из одного действующего вещества.
Компонент представляет собой готовый продукт, в котором содержится один или несколько составных частей.
*For example: '5 mg' where the Constituent amount is '1 ml' as an alternate ingredient amount for a substance with strength '5mg/1ml'.(en)
Альтернативное, но эквивалентное представление о количестве компонента.
Идентификатор присваивается партии лекарственных средств производителем в процессе производства.
*For example: "2 mg/0.5 ml", "5 mg/10 g" or "10 ml/500 ml".(en)

*The substance amount is usually given using mass, volume or arbitrary units. However, there may be examples where other unit dimensions are used. For example: "5 mg", "100 ml", "20 IU" . Where a preparation strength is described as "5 mg/10 g", "5 mg" is the substance amount.(en)

*The diluent amount is usually given using mass or volume units. However, there may be examples where other unit dimensions are used. For example: "5 g", "100 ml". Where a preparation strength is described as "5 mg/10 g", "10 g" is the diluent amount.(en)

*Some vendors prefer giving strength for administration units such as tablets or puffs as a nominator quantity of mass, while leaving the denominator implied. The preferred way of recording strength is using the 'Strength as concentration' element.(en)
Масса активного вещества на массу компонента.
*This is not limited to activities performed based on medication orders from clinicians, but could also include for example taking over the counter medication.(en)

Любая деятельность, связанная с планированием, подготовкой, управлением рецептами, выдачей, администрированием, прекращением и другим использованием лекарств, вакцины, пищевого продукта или другого терапевтического предмета.
*This is not limited to activities performed based on medication orders from clinicians, but could also include for example taking over the counter medication.!(en)

*Any activity related to the planning, scheduling, prescription management, dispensing, administration, cessation and other use of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item.!(en)
*This is not limited to activities performed based on medication orders from clinicians, but could also include for example taking over the counter medication.!!(en)

*Any activity related to the planning, scheduling, prescription management, dispensing, administration, cessation and other use of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item.!!(en)
Назначенный препарат был отпущен, например, из аптечного пункта пациенту.

Препарат впервые был применён / введён пациенту. Хотя при некоторых условиях эта важная дата может вычисляться по первому применению / введению из серии, в условиях первичной мед. помощи, конкретные даты применения / приёма могут быть недоступны в явном виде.
Конкретный препарат был скорректирован по плану. Не подразумевает корректировку листа препатаов в целом.
*The medication course has been completed as planned.(en)
Отпуск по рецепту не произошёл вследствие проблем с поставкой / по техническим причинам.
Применение / приём препарата было приостановлено до особого распоряжения. Без соблюдения условий повторного приёма / до даты повторного приёма препарат не подлежит применению.
Рецепт был перевыпущен под текущее назначение.
Выдача повторного рецепта невозможна без вмешательства третьего лица.
Запланированный курс медикаментозной терапии был отменён до момента применения/приёма внутрь препарата.
Запланированный курс медикаментозной терапии был отложен до момента применения/приёма внутрь препарата.
Применение / приём препарата был прекращён после применения / приёма первой дозы, но до завершения предполагаемого курса.
Время начала применения / приёма препарата, или иное условие начала применения / приёма было установлено.

От применения или введения дозы воздержались. Переносить применение / введение дозы на другое время не предполагается, хотя следующее применение / введение следующей дозы (если есть) должно быть в рамках текущего назначения.

*For example: 'Atenolol 100mg' or 'Tenormin tablets 100mg'. It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' is coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.(en)
*Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item which was the focus of the activity.(en)

*For example: 'Postponed - Patient not avalable at administration time', 'Cancelled - Adverse reaction'. Note: This is not the reason for the medication instruction, but rather the specific reason that a care step was carried out, and will often be used to document some variance from the original order.(en)
*Reason that the pathway step for the identified medication was carried out.(en)
*For example: 'Patient was in radiology department', 'Accidental injection into blood vessel during IM administration'.(en)
*Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields, including details of any variance between the intended action and the action actually performed.(en)
*The sequence number specific to the activity being recorded.(en)
*For example: 'Avoid grapefruit' , 'Take at least 2 hours before bedtime', 'Take with food'. May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate.(en)
*Any guidance, instructions or advice given to the subject of care or personal carer at the time of the pathway step.(en)
Вследствие необходимости значительных изменений в назначении, действие данного назначения останавливается, выпускается замещающее назначение.
Назначение было изменено таким образом, что согласно местным регулирующим предписаниям не требует нового назначения.
*Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.(en)
*The datetime at which the medication action was scheduled to occur.(en)
Применение / введение дозы отсрочено, но предполагается провести его в самое ближайшее время.
*Further structured details of the action, possibly specific to a pathway step.(en)
*Comment: This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.(en)

*Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the dispensed, authorised or administered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.(en)
*Structured details about the medication including strength, form and constituent substances.(en)

Первоначальное назначение было подтверждено повторно с целью выписки повторного рецепта или для повторного отпуска препарата. В некоторых юрисдикциях при таких условиях следует создать новое назначение.
Препарат был рекомендован, однако никаких действий по выписке рецепта ещё не предпринято.
*Dosage_administration is intended to carry details of medication order changes or dose administrations, whilst medication_supply_amount is intended for details of dispensing-related activity.(en)
*Specific details about the amount of the medication item.(en)

*In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.(en)
*Subsitution action taken by the person administering or dispensing the drug.(en)
*For example: "Generic alternative contains a substance that is not tolerated by the patient." May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate(en)
*The reason or justification for the substitution action taken.(en)
*A medication was substituted which is bioequivalent to that ordered.(en)
*Although allowed by the medication order a bioequvalent medication was not substituted.(en)
*Details of body site and administration of the medication.(en)
*For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'. Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Structured description of the site of administration of the ordered item.(en)
*For example: "On the medial skin surface of the left forearm, from 10 cm to 20 cm distally from the point of the elbow".(en)
*Structured description of the site of administration of the medication, vaccine or therapeutic good.(en)
*Comment: For example: ' via Z-track injection'; 'via nebuliser'. Coding of the method with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*The technique or device by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered.(en)
*Details of the medical device used to assist administration of the medication.(en)

Черновик рецепта подготовлен и ожидает подтверждения от уполномоченного медработника. Может использоваться в ситуациях, когда выписка повторных рецептов выполняется серийно. Этот шаг может иметь статуc 'запланированный' или 'активный', для отображения необхоимости обрабатывать как новые, так и повторные назначения.
*Comment: For example: 'oral', 'intravenous', or 'topical'. Coding of the route with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Multiple potential routes may be specified.(en)
*The route by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered into the subject's body.(en)
Препарат был физически приготовлен. Например: приготовление внутривенной смеси.
*Details of the individual performing the double-check can be carried in the Reference Model element "Participation".(en)
*The action step has been checked by a separate individual.(en)
Рецепт был аннулирован до момента выдачи.
Рецепт признан недействительным или срок действия рецепта истёк до реализации.
*The date/time on which the medication course is set to restart, as per the "Medication restart date/condition set" pathway step.(en)
*The criterion which triggers the medication course to restart, as per the "Medication restart date/condition set" pathway step.(en)
Взаимодействие, обмен информацией или предоставление медицинской помощи в рамках посещения пациентом медицинского учреждения лично или с помощью удалённой связи.
*e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
